intro: Spermacoce scabiosoides, commonly known as the false ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce scabiosoides is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas in moist, well-drained soils.
